title: Untangling mechanized proofs
Web-dev advice for building a localhost app w/o a steep learning curve?
description:
TL;DR: I am a C++/ObjC guy with a basic knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS. I want to build a dynamic web-app (to be served on localhost) quickly. What client-side library can I use that will save me from doing everything by hand, but without having to learn & master a complicated framework like React or Elm?

I‚Äôm primarily a desktop/mobile developer, and in recent years I‚Äôve focused on non-UI C++ library code, but I‚Äôm delving back into web dev for a side project of mine. This project is client-side, cross-platform, and needs UI, so the easiest approach is to drop a little HTTP server into it and serve up a website on localhost.

I‚Äôve dabbled in web dev off and on since 1995, but never that seriously. I know HTML, CSS, JS, DOM, XHR ‚Ä¶ but basically as they were in 2008. I‚Äôve never used the fancy frameworks the kids are into nowadays, like React or Elm. So the logic I‚Äôve done so far has been by typing ‚Äúdocument.getElementById(‚Äúbutton1‚Äù).onclick = function() {‚Ä¶‚Äù, they same way I did it in 2000.

I wonder if there are better ways to do this now, that don‚Äôt require a big learning curve or reading a 500-page book. On the View side I grabbed Bootstrap, which has really helped me put together a halfway-nice looking layout. But what about the M and C?

Ironically, the ubiquity of web-dev makes it hard to learn about this by googling, because the web is full of awful clickbaity content-farm sites about the Top 50 Bootstrap Themes, or The Best React Tutorial, or Teach Yourself CSS In Two Hours‚Ä¶ So I thought I might get better advice from the fellow brainiacs here on lobste.rs.

Some random thoughts:

  • This is a localhost-only single-user site, so I don‚Äôt care about scalability, performance or auth. Bandwidth is infinite so building a SPA seems pointless.
  • It‚Äôs more or less a social-network app: posts, feeds, user profiles‚Ä¶
  • I‚Äôve already cobbled together a basic C++ server-side framework with regex routes (cpp-httplib) and templates (inja).
  • I‚Äôm agnostic about putting logic on the ‚Äúclient‚Äù vs. ‚Äúserver‚Äù side; it‚Äôs the same CPU and the same programmer.
  • I probably want to use TypeScript, as I prefer fixing bugs at compile-time.
  • What do the cool kids do for server push nowadays? (Does just saying ‚Äúserver push‚Äù make me sound old?)
